info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 24 at 6:39AM CDT until September 24 at 10:45AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Arkansas, including the following counties, in south central Arkansas, Union. In southwest Arkansas, Columbia, Lafayette and southeastern Miller.
* WHEN...Until 1045 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 637 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain, with isolated higher amounts have quickly fallen with this cluster of thunderstorms. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches, with isolated higher amounts up to 3 inches, are expected over the area through mid morning. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Should the heavy rain persist over these same areas, a Flash Flood Warning will be needed. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... El Dorado, Magnolia, Springhill, Smackover, Stamps, Waldo, Lewisville, Norphlet, Huttig, Junction City, McNeil, Bradley, Taylor, Strong, Calion, Emerson, Buckner, Village, Atlanta and Mount Holly. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Columbia, AR; Lafayette, AR; Miller, AR; Union, AR
